hero.missionText: Erasmus+ programme enables us to have amazing learning adventures with inspirational people from different countries. However, each of our personal gatherings contributes to a deep carbon footprint due to our travelling and living habits. The purpose of this project was to offset our carbon footprint on the projects we make by bringing more awareness and more action to change our habits. For this reason, we have created a carbon footprint calculator that is specialized for Erasmus+ projects such as youth exchanges, training courses, meetings etc. This calculator offers the final number of the CO‚ÇÇ produced by each participant and transforms this number to the number of the average trees that will absorb our CO‚ÇÇ in their lifetime. Our calculations are based on scientific research done by different professionals. We did not make our own calculations.
hero.visionText: We want to create a movement, where each Erasmus+ project calculates their carbon footprint and plants trees to offset it. We see several Erasmus+ forests rising in Europe which contribute to the cleaner air in Europe. We see young people continuing to learn together in a more sustainable environment, while travelling green, and enjoying the beauty of nature. This website has so much knowledge gathered for you, so take some time and search a bit around.

workshops.intro1: We are very happy you have found a way to our Greendex page. This page will help you bring awareness of sustainable and eco-friendly habits on the Erasmus+ project.
workshops.intro2: In this section we offer you three different workshops for you to use on your learning mobility, depending on your time:
workshops.bottomP1: You can use the same workshop on every single mobility, because the numbers will always be different. These workshops will bring awareness about the sustainability of this mobility and will inspire you to take some actions. Sustainability is not just a topic, is a principle we should all live by.
workshops.bottomP2Prefix: If you are interested to learn more about the sustainability, go to sections

plastic.title: 3.1. How much plastic do we own?

form_groups.title: Form national groups
form_groups.content: Ask participants to form national groups and position themselves in the room.

bring_items.title: Invite participants to bring all plastic and non-recyclable items
bring_items.content: Ask them to go through their luggage and bring to the room everything that is plastic or cannot be recycled. They should be very thorough. If they do not wish to bring their personal items to the room, they should count them. They should count every credit card, shoes, toothbrush, cables, shampoo bottles etc.

calculate.title: Let's calculate some numbers
calculate.content: Invite every national group to sum the number of all plastic items and/or the ones that cannot be recycled. Invite them to calculate items per person in the team. Facilitator should sum items for the entire mobility and an average per person of the mobility. Display the results on the poster or a board.

debate.title: Debate
debate.content:
Look at the numbers and invite participants to express their thoughts and emotions. You may also ask them the following questions:

‚Ä¢ How many items are you planning to leave here?
‚Ä¢ Are there any items here, you could replace with something else? If yes, which items can you replace with what?
‚Ä¢ Are there any items here, you cannot replace right now, because you are waiting for the technology to improve?
‚Ä¢ Are there any items where the producer can do something about it?

introduce.title: Introducing the Greendex website
introduce.content: Introduce our website to participants as it holds several tips about how to improve daily routine and offers additional resources for study.

create_groups.title: Create smaller intercultural groups
create_groups.content: Create smaller intercultural groups or stay in the same if you use this activity as a continuation of the previous activity!

think_products.title: Think of some products you love
think_products.content: Maybe there are some special cookies you love to eat or shoes you like to wear. Think of some products you love to use but are wrapped in too much packaging. Maybe you use some product that does not need to be made of plastic? Each group should decide on one such product.

find_solutions.title: Find some solutions if possible
find_solutions.content: If possible, find a solution for your product that would satisfy you.

write_message.title: Write a message to the producers
write_message.content: Write a polite message or a letter to the producers of the product you were talking about. Make sure you write the message in a form of say something positive, say something negative, suggest improvement.

use_hashtag.title: Use #greendex
use_hashtag.content: If you decide to publish this message on social media, we kindly ask you to use #greendex for a better visibility of this movement.

form_groups.title: Form smaller intercultural groups
form_groups.content: Let them find a comfortable place in the room and prepare at least one smartphone. It is important to provide access to the internet.

name_group.title: Ask participants to name their group
name_group.content: This has a team building purpose and will help you identify the answers better.

introduce_quiz.title: Introducing the quiz
introduce_quiz.content: Explain to participants that we will guide them through a short quiz, and they are allowed to use smartphones.

start_quiz.title: Start the quiz
start_quiz.content:
You can read the questions, post them on the paper, or form some sort of online tool for participants to use. This is not a competition, just research.

Before the quiz starts, ask two very basic questions:

‚Ä¢ Do you know what a carbon footprint is?
Answer: A carbon footprint is the total amount of greenhouse gasses that are generated by our actions.

‚Ä¢ Why do we talk about Carbon Dioxide ‚Äì CO‚ÇÇ?
Answer: Too much carbon dioxide (and other greenhouse gasses such as methane) in the atmosphere warms the planet, causing climate change.

Here are the questions:
‚Ä¢ How much CO‚ÇÇ is released by a meat eater?
‚Ä¢ How much CO‚ÇÇ is released by a vegetarian?
‚Ä¢ How much CO‚ÇÇ is released when flying 1000 km?
‚Ä¢ How much CO‚ÇÇ is released when traveling 1000 km by train?
‚Ä¢ How much CO‚ÇÇ is released when traveling 1000 km by car?
‚Ä¢ How much CO‚ÇÇ is absorbed by one coniferous tree?
‚Ä¢ How much CO‚ÇÇ is absorbed by one deciduous tree?
‚Ä¢ How much O2 does one person need in a year (in kg)?
‚Ä¢ How much O2 does one average tree produce in a year (in kg)?
‚Ä¢ How many people are currently in the world?

debate.title: Debate
debate.content:
Encourage participants to share thoughts and emotions about the results. You may ask them the following questions:

‚Ä¢ What was the most interesting in your research?
‚Ä¢ Was there something that brought out some emotions? If yes, which emotions and why?
‚Ä¢ Were you able to recognize the ratio between the number absorbed CO‚ÇÇ and released O2?
‚Ä¢ How densely planted are trees in your country?

evaluate.title: Dedicate time for final evaluation
evaluate.content:
We invite you to dedicate a small amount of time in your final evaluation on the last day of your mobility, to ask a few green questions. You may ask them the following questions:

‚Ä¢ How aware were you about your environmentally (un)friendly habits?
‚Ä¢ Have you recognised something you could do to change your habits?
‚Ä¢ Have you participated in the proposed challenges?
‚Ä¢ How successful were you in your challenges?
‚Ä¢ Is there any challenge you think you could do for the rest of your life?
‚Ä¢ Would you be willing to integrate some challenges into your life?
‚Ä¢ What else can you do to reduce your carbon footprint?

What can you post on the social media, using #greendex:
‚Ä¢ Number of trees to plant
‚Ä¢ Which challenges have you decided to participate in?
‚Ä¢ Social pressure letter.
